intro: Urera engleriana, commonly known as the white urera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white, fragrant flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
